title: 26,582 persons vaccinated  against COVID-19
body_lines: COVID-19 vaccines were administered to 26,582 persons on Monday, with first dose coverage in the country reaching 78.75%.
Our World in Data states that 66.1% of the total population has received the second vaccine dose.
According to the Epidemiology Unit, 16,932,560 persons have received the first dose of a COVID-19 vaccine and 14,215,095 persons have received the second dose of a vaccine.
The third dose has been administered to 7,347,487 persons. This includes 19,126 persons vaccinated on Monday.

The first dose of Pfizer was administered to 2,173 persons on Monday and the second dose was administered to 2,968 persons. A total of 2,462,816 persons have received the first dose of Pfizer and 748,440 persons have received the second dose as well.

On Monday, 791 persons received the first dose of Sinopharm and 1,524 persons received the second dose of the vaccine. The first dose of Sinopharm has been administered to 12,026,202 persons and the second dose has been administered to 11,104,889 persons. A total of 1,479,631 persons have received the first dose of AstraZeneca and 1,418,593 persons have received the second dose of the vaccine.
The Epidemiology Unit states that 804,801 persons have received the first dose of Moderna, with the second dose of the vaccine administered to 787,361 persons.
The first dose of Sputnik V has been administered to 159,110 persons and the second dose has been administered to 155,812 persons.
